description:
The erection of a basement and six storey building for
office purposes together with roof-top plant room and rear
servicing area, refuse stores and cycle shed accessed off
Endsleigh Gardens,
as shown by drawing numbers: Applicant's letter of 24th
March 2000  photographs; 9953/:- 10D; 11D; 16C; 17C; 18C;
19C; 21A SK01; SK02; and transport impact statement.
decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - No loading or unloading of goods, including fuel, by vehicles arriving at or departing from the premises shall be carried out otherwise than within the curtilage of the building.

Reason: To avoid obstruction of the surrounding streets and to safeguard amenities of adjacent premises in accordance with the requirements of policy TR23 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 2 - The areas shown on the approved drawings as cycle parking,
    access, servicing and manoeuvring areas shall be provided
    and not used other than for these purposes.

Condition : 3 - No plant shall be installed on the roof save for within the
    enclosed roof plant areas shown on the approved drawings and
    no such plant shall be visible above the screening hereby
    approved.

Condition : 4 - No servicing of the building from Endsleigh Gardens shall
    take place outside the hours of 0830 hrs to 1900 hrs Monday
    to Friday or 1000 hrs to 1900 hrs Saturday or Sunday.

Condition : 5 - The facing materials to be used on the ................. shall not be otherwise than as shall have been submitted to and approved by the Council before any work on the site is commenced.

Condition : 6 - In good time, prior to the commencement of the development,
    full details of a scheme of soft landscaping for the
    elevation facing Friends Garden shall be submitted to and
    approved by the Council in writing. That scheme shall be
    fully implemented  in strict accordance with the details
    thus approved within 6 months of the building's first
    occupation or the end of the first planting season
    thereafter; such landscaping to be maintained permanently on
    the building.

Condition : 7 - In good time, prior to the first occupation of the building,
    full details of cycle parking shall be submitted to and
    approved by the Council. That scheme shall be fully
    implemented in strict accordance with the details thus
    approved and maintained permanently thereafter.

Condition : 8 - In good time, prior to the first occupation of the building,
    full details of the means of refuse enclosure shall be
    submitted to and approved by the Council. That scheme shall
    be fully implemented in strict accordance with the details
    thus approved and maintained permanently thereafter.

Condition : 9 - The development shall be constructed in strict accordance with the drawings hereby approved or drawings which are subsequently approved pursuant to conditions which are attached to this planning permission.

Condition : 10 - At 1 metre outside the windows of any neighbouring habitable room the level of noise from all plant and machinery shall be at all times at least 5 decibels below the existing background noise levels, expressed in dB(A) at such locations. Where the noise from the plant and machinery is tonal in character the differences in these levels shall be at least 10 dB(A).

Reason: To safeguard the amenities of the [adjoining] premises [and the area generally] in accordance with the requirements of policy[ies] RE2[, EN5, EN6 and DS6] of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 11 - To avoid obstruction of the surrounding streets and to
    safeguard amenities of adjacent premises.

Condition : 12 - To ensure the availability of the facilities in
    accordance with the approved scheme.

Condition : 13 - As such plant is considered to be injurious to visual
    amenities and detrimental to the character and appearance of
    the Bloomsbury Conservation Area.

Condition : 14 - To safeguard the amenities of the adjoining premises and the
    area generally.

Condition : 15 - To ensure that the Council may be satisfied with the
    external appearance of the building.

Condition : 16 - In order that the Council may give consideration to the
    details of the proposed development.

Condition : 17 - In order that the Council may give consideration to the
    details of the proposed development.

Condition : 18 - In order that the Council may give consideration to the
    details of the proposed development.

Condition : 19 - To safeguard the appearance of the premises and the
    character of the immediate area.

Condition : 20 - To safeguard the amenities of the adjoining premises and the
    area generally.

Condition : 21 - The correct street number or number and name must be
    displayed permanently on the premises in accordance with
    regulations made under Section 12 of the London Building
    (Amendments) Act 1939.

Condition : 22 - Your attention is drawn to the fact that there is a separate
    legal agreement with the Council which relates to the
    development for which this permission is granted.

Condition : 23 - The Building Regulations may impose requirements for the
    provision of access and sanitary conveniences for people
    with a physical impairment which limits their ability to
    walk, and people who need to use a wheelchair. In this
    respect you are advised to  consult the Council's
    Building Control Services, Camden Town Hall, Argyle Street
    WC1H 8EQ. (Tel:020 7974 6941)

Condition : 24 - Works of construction and ancillary activity should not take
    place other than between the hours of 08.00am to 18.00 pm on
    Monday to Friday and 08.00am to 13.00pm on Saturday, with no
    working on Sunday or Bank Holidays, in order to comply with
    locally enforced standards.
